title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.14| 9-08-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjani Chalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: He knew how to give charity, to whom charity should be given and when it should be given.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains that King Yudhishthira knew the proper way to give charity.

segments.key_quote: Dana or charity or dakshina only given to brahmanas and sannyasis for the spiritual service they render to service spiritual service they render to the society free of charge
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's perspective that charity (dana/dakshina) is specifically meant for brahmanas and sannyasis who provide spiritual service without charge, emphasizing that this is different from helping the poor.

segments.key_quote: wealth is distributed to the brahmanas because the brahmanas give the highest quality of service in regard to the prime necessity of humankind.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the importance of giving charity to qualified brahmanas, highlighting their role in providing spiritual upliftment and welfare to society.

segments.key_quote: They lived a simple life, even though they had, in the form of dakshina or dana, all these things which are given, but they never made a show of that, neither they exploited.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how brahmanas, although receiving substantial charity, lived simple lives dedicated to the well-being of society, without exploiting their position.

segments.key_quote: Charity has got a purpose. Giving charity is purposefully given.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of giving charity with purpose, considering the place, time, and recipient, as outlined in the scriptures, and contrasts this with the commercialization of services in Kali Yuga.

segments.key_quote: But Vedic culture is, brahmanas are never commercially oriented.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the Vedic system of taxation, where only Vaishyas (businessmen) were taxed, and the collected taxes were used by Kshatriyas for the welfare and protection of all citizens, while brahmanas were exempt.

segments.key_quote: A needy person should be shown compassion. Daya. Not Dana. Not Dakshina.
segments.summary: The speaker refutes the concept of 'Daridra Narayana' (poor Narayana), clarifying that charity (dana) is meant for spiritually enlightened individuals, while the poor should be shown compassion (daya) and helped with basic needs.
